summary: An email from a US Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) staff member discussing coordination on Epstein case matters, including a Los Angeles trip, progress on prosecution memos, and a potential estate investigation involving a proffer and Civil Division involvement.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.context: Sender of the email discussing Epstein case coordination, including a potential estate investigation and prosecution memos.

persons.name: Unknown
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referenced as being out on Tuesday for a closing, with scheduling for case discussions.

connections.description: Email exchange between two US Attorney's Office staff members coordinating on Epstein case matters.

events.title: Email Coordination on Epstein Case
events.description: Email sent to schedule a team meeting to discuss the LA trip, progress on prosecution memos, and a potential estate investigation involving a proffer and Civil Division.

keyFacts: The email indicates ongoing Epstein case work by the US Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) as of November 2019.
Discussions include a potential estate investigation, suggesting scrutiny of Epstein's assets or estate post-mortem.
Mentions a 'proffer' and 'Civ div involvement', indicating potential cooperation discussions and Civil Division engagement.
References a 'LA trip', which may relate to investigative travel connected to the case.
Shows internal coordination on 'progress on pros memos', meaning prosecution memoranda were being developed.
